intro: Licania ferreirae, commonly known as the Brazilian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Licania ferreirae is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
